measured_by: accumulation rate parameter of evidence-accumulation models
justification: “Accumulation rates measure the strength (signal-to-noise ratio) of evidence extracted from the stimulus … Holding one constant allows measurement of the other.”

measured_by: threshold / boundary-separation parameter of an EAM
justification: “Thresholds control the amount of evidence needed to trigger a response and thus measure response caution or speed-accuracy settings.”

“In relative evidence models … the evidence starting point is assumed to be under the control of the decision maker … Starting point biases have been used to measure biases in police officers’ decisions…”
“Nondecision time measures the sum of the time taken to encode the stimulus … and time to produce the motor response.”

measured_by: across-trial variability in accumulation rate parameter
justification: “Across-trial rate variability can be used … to identify factors that lead to increased uncertainty (greater variability) in decision making.”

topic_or_construct: variability in prior beliefs or expectations
justification: “Starting point variability may be used to account for factors affecting uncertainty (variability) in prior beliefs or expectations.”
